newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Kwasniewski says Central Europe united on EU, NATO.
newsitem.headline: Kwasniewski says Central Europe united on EU, NATO.

text.p: Polish president Aleksander Kwasniewski, starting a two-day working visit to Hungary, said on Monday Poland, Hungary and the Czech Republic would form a close-knit group as they approach EU and NATO membership.

"We agreed that Hungary and Poland should closely cooperate (in Euro-Atlantic integration) and that all countries of the region, particularly the Czech Republic, should be involved in this system of relations," Kwasniewski told reporters after meeting his Hungarian counterpart Arpad Goncz.
"Poland, Hungary and the Czech Republic should hold regular consultations on presidential, prime ministerial and ministerial level in the near future," he said.
The three states are now seen as favourites to form the first group of countries to open talks on joining both NATO and the European Union.
Goncz said there was no question of one country trying to outflank the others in accession talks to either organisation.
"We are not competitors but strategic partners on the road leading towards NATO and the European Union," he said. @
Kwasniewski is in Hungary to open a retrospective exhibition of Polish art, and on Tuesday will deliver a lecture to the Hungarian Foreign Affairs Institute.
